au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.util
Class GlassPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.util.GlassPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.AWTEventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class GlassPane
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.AWTEventListener

This is the glass pane class that intercepts screen interactions during system busy states.

See Also:
Serialized Form

eventDispatched

public void eventDispatched(java.awt.AWTEvent event)
Receives all key events in the AWT and processes the ones that originated from the current window with the glass pane.

mount

public static GlassPane mount(java.awt.Component startComponent,
                              boolean create)
Finds the glass pane that is related to the specified component.

Parameters:
startComponent - the component used to start the search for the glass pane
create - a flag whether to create a glass pane if one does not exist
Returns:
GlassPane

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean value)
Sets the glass pane as visible or invisible. The mouse cursor will be set accordingly.
